name: Dark Matter Evidence
explanation: Dark matter is invisible matter detected only by gravitational effects. Galaxy rotation curves show stars orbit faster than visible mass predicts - indicating 5-10× more mass than visible. Dark matter makes up ~27% of universe. Composition unknown (WIMPs, axions, etc.). Essential for galaxy formation and structure.

examples.problem: Why do we know dark matter exists?
examples.solution: Galaxy rotation curves - stars move too fast for visible mass
steps: Implies M(r) ∝ r (mass increases with distance)
But visible mass concentrated in center

examples.solution: Unknown - doesn't interact with light, only gravity
steps: Doesn't emit, absorb, or reflect light
Candidates: WIMPs, axions, primordial black holes
